place.name: GARTHELI
place.gazetteerText: GARTHELY, a chapelry in Llanddewi-brefi parish, Cardigan; near the river Ayron, 6½ miles WSW of Tregaron r. station, and 17½ S of Aberystwith. Post town, Lampeter, under Carmarthen. Acres, 2, 475. Real property, £561. Pop., 296. Houses, 60. The property is divided among a few. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £60. Patron, the Incumbent of Llanddewi-brefi. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
